verses.text: 基督既然在肉身受過苦，你們也應當以同樣的心志裝備自己，

words.note: Refers to the physical, mortal body, often in a theological sense.

verses.text: 好叫你們不再隨從人的私慾，只順從 神的旨意，在世上度餘下的光陰。

words.note: More common in older literary or biblical Chinese.
Refers to carnal or sinful desires.
In biblical context, refers to the singular God.
Often used for God's will.
Literary term for time, often precious time.

verses.text: 因為你們過去隨從教外人的心意，行邪淫、私慾、醉酒、荒宴、狂飲和可憎拜偶像的事，時候已經夠了。

words.note: Refers to non-Christians or non-Jews.
Refers to illicit sexual behavior.
Refers to carnal or sinful desires.
Refers to riotous or uncontrolled feasting.
Stronger than 'drunkenness', implying wild, uncontrolled drinking.

verses.text: 他們見你們不再與他們同奔那縱情放蕩的路，就覺得奇怪，毀謗你們。

words.note: Literary or formal expression for 'run together'.
A four-character idiom describing unrestrained and immoral behavior.

verses.text: 他們必要向那位預備要審判活人死人的主交帳。

words.note: Refers to divine judgment in this context.
When capitalized, refers to God or Jesus.
Figuratively, to be held accountable for one's actions.

verses.text: 因此，那些死人也曾有福音傳給他們，好使他們的肉體受了人要受的審判，他們的靈卻靠 神活著。

words.note: Indicates past action or state.
Lit. 'blessed news'.
Often used in a theological sense as 'fleshly nature'.
In a legal and theological context.
Refers to the immaterial part of a being, often linked to God.
The preceding space is a common reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 萬物的結局近了，所以你們要謹慎警醒地禱告。

words.note: Refers to all creation or the universe.
Implies spiritual vigilance.

verses.heading: Service, Suffering, and Judgment

verses.text: 最重要的是要彼此切實相愛，因為愛能遮蓋許多的罪。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'that which is important'.
Often refers to agape love in biblical context.
In a theological context, referring to transgression against divine law.

verses.text: 你們要互相接待，不發怨言。

words.note: In Christian context, refers to hospitality towards others, especially strangers or fellow believers.

verses.text: 你們要作 神各樣恩賜的好管家，各人照著所領受的恩賜彼此服事。

words.note: The preceding space is a common reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to divine favor or spiritual endowments.
In a biblical sense, a manager of another's household or resources.
A particle used to nominalize a verb or verb phrase.
Refers to divine favor or spiritual endowments.
Often implies service to God or fellow believers.

verses.text: 講道的，應當按著 神的聖言講；服事的，應當按著 神所賜的力量服事，為要在一切事上，使 神藉耶穌基督得榮耀。榮耀、權能都是他的，直到永永遠遠。阿們。

words.note: Refers to preaching God's word.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
Often used for gifts from a superior to an inferior.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
Less common than 藉著 or 透過.
Transliteration of Hebrew word.

verses.text: 親愛的，有火煉的試驗臨到你們，不要以為奇怪，好像是遭遇非常的事，
倒要歡喜，因為你們既然在基督的受苦上有分，就在他榮耀顯現的時候，可以歡喜快樂。
你們要是為基督的名受辱罵，就有福了！因為 神榮耀的靈，住在你們身上。

words.note: A common phrase in beatitudes.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
Often refers to the Holy Spirit in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 你們中間不可有人因為殺人、或偷竊、或行惡、或好管閒事而受苦。

words.note: Lit. 'fond of minding idle matters'.

verses.text: 如果因為作基督徒而受苦，不要以為羞恥，倒要藉著這名字榮耀 神。

words.note: Can also mean 'glory' (n.).
The preceding space indicates reverence.

verses.text: 因為審判從 神的家開始，就在這時候了。如果先從我們起頭，那不信從 神福音的人，結局將要怎樣呢？

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence.
Combines 'not', 'believe', and 'obey'.
The preceding space indicates reverence.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 「如果義人僅僅得救，不敬虔和犯罪的人，又會變成怎樣呢？（「不敬虔和犯罪的人，又會變成怎樣呢？」直譯作「不敬虔的人和犯罪的人將出現在何處呢？」）」
所以那順著 神的旨意而受苦的人，要繼續地行善，把自己的生命交託那信實的創造者。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence.
Often refers to God's will or purpose.

words.definition: to do good, perform good deeds
